motivation.quote: I think it is necessary to say that what is basic and what is needed in the Middle East is peace. Peace for Israel is one thing. Peace for the Arab side of that world is another thing. Peace for Israel means security, and we must stand with all of our might to protect its right to exist, its territorial integrity. I see Israel, and never mind saying it, as one of the great outposts of democracy in the world, and a marvelous ex­ample of what can be done, how desert land almost can be transformed into an oasis of brotherhood and democracy. Peace for Israel means security and that security must be a reality.
motivation.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

motivation.quote: Science is the captain, and practice the soldiers.
motivation.author: Leonardo da Vinci

motivation.quote: The belief that youth is the happiest time of life is founded upon a fallacy. The happiest person is the person who thinks the most interesting thoughts, and we grow happier as we grow older.
motivation.author: William Phelps

motivation.quote: To the world you may be just one person, but to one person, you may be the world.
motivation.author: Brandi Snyder

motivation.quote: In every adversity there lies the seed of an equivalent advantage. In every defeat is a lesson showing you how to win the victory next time.
motivation.author: Robert Collier

motivation.quote: Each day, accept everything that comes to you as a gift. At night, mentally give it all back. In this way, you become free.
motivation.author: Daniel Levin

motivation.quote: You may say Im a dreamer, but Im not the only one, I hope someday you will join us, and the world will live as one.
motivation.author: John Lennon

motivation.quote: The intuition of free will gives us the truth.
motivation.author: Corliss Lamont

motivation.quote: I love my past. I love my present. Im not ashamed of what Ive had, and Im not sad because I have it no longer.
motivation.author: Colette

motivation.quote: Continuous effort—not strength or intelligence—is the key to unlocking our potential.
motivation.author: Winston Churchill

motivation.quote: Arrogance and rudeness are training wheels on the bicycle of life — for weak people who cannot keep their balance without them.
motivation.author: Laura Teresa Marquez

motivation.quote: The first duty of a human being is to assume the right functional relationship to society — more briefly, to find your real job, and do it.
motivation.author: Charlotte Perkins Gilman

motivation.quote: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive — to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
motivation.author: Marcus Aurelius

motivation.quote: This is love: to fly toward a secret sky, to cause a hundred veils to fall each moment. First to let go of life. Finally, to take a step without feet.
motivation.author: Rumi

motivation.quote: Develop an attitude of gratitude, and give thanks for everything that happens to you, knowing that every step forward is a step toward achieving something bigger and better than your current situation.
motivation.author: Brian Tracy

motivation.quote: When we see men of worth, we should think of equaling them; when we see men of a contrary character, we should turn inwards and examine ourselves.
motivation.author: Confucius

motivation.quote: Growth begins when we begin to accept our own weakness.
motivation.author: Jean Vanier

motivation.quote: Going back to zero can help creative juices no matter the art form you are attempting to create.
motivation.author: Byron Pulsifer

motivation.quote: In reality, the only way a relationship will last is if you see your relationship as a place that you go to give, and not a place that you go to take.
motivation.author: Anthony Robbins

motivation.quote: Happiness is a Swedish sunset — it is there for all, but most of us look the other way and lose it.
motivation.author: Mark Twain

motivation.quote: Nothing happens unless first a dream.
motivation.author: Carl Sandburg

motivation.quote: Put your future in good hands — your own.
motivation.author: Unknown

motivation.quote: Success builds character. Failure reveals it.
motivation.author: Dave Checketts

motivation.quote: Love and kindness are never wasted. They always make a difference. They bless the one who receives them, and they bless you, the giver.
motivation.author: Barbara De Angelis

motivation.quote: If you break your neck, if you have nothing to eat, if your house is on fire, then you got a problem.  Everything else is inconvenience.
motivation.author: Robert Fulghum

motivation.quote: Life can be found only in the present moment. The past is gone, the future is not yet here, and if we do not go back to ourselves in the present moment, we cannot be in touch with life.
motivation.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

motivation.quote: The secret of joy in work is contained in one word — excellence. To know how to do something well is to enjoy it.
motivation.author: Pearl Buck:

motivation.quote: Letting go isn’t the end of the world; it’s the beginning of a new life.
motivation.author: Unknown

motivation.quote: Beauty is all around us amidst strife and turmoil to be seen by those who look not to those who wish.
motivation.author: Byron Pulsifer

motivation.quote: Few will have the greatness to bend history itself; but each of us can work to change a small portion of events, and in the total of all those acts will be written the history of this generation.
motivation.author: Robert Kennedy

motivation.quote: You cannot do a kindness too soon because you never know how soon it will be too late.
motivation.author: Ralph Emerson

motivation.quote: You must train your intuition — you must trust the small voice inside you which tells you exactly what to say, what to decide.
motivation.author: Ingrid Bergman

motivation.quote: Life is thickly sown with thorns, and I know no other remedy than to pass quickly through them. The longer we dwell on our misfortunes, the greater is their power to harm us.
motivation.author: Voltaire

motivation.quote: No one who achieves success does so without the help of others. The wise and confident acknowledge this help with gratitude.
motivation.author: Alfred North Whitehead

motivation.quote: Our true wealth is the good we do in this world. None of us has faith unless we desire for our neighbours what we desire for ourselves.
motivation.author: Mohammed

motivation.quote: The young people who come to me in the hope of hearing me utter a few memorable maxims are quite disappointed. Aphorisms are not my forte, I say nothing but banalities... I listen to them and they go away delighted.
motivation.author: Andre Gide

motivation.quote: A good teacher is like a candle — it consumes itself to light the way for others.
motivation.author: Unknown

motivation.quote: What we call the secret of happiness is no more a secret than our willingness to choose life.
motivation.author: Leo Buscaglia

motivation.quote: Such is the state of life, that none are happy but by the anticipation of change: the change itself is nothing; when we have made it, the next wish is to change again.
motivation.author: Samuel Johnson

motivation.quote: People are like stained glass windows: they sparkle and shine when the sun is out, but when the darkness sets in their true beauty is revealed only if there is a light within.
motivation.author: Elizabeth Kubler-Ross

motivation.quote: We learn wisdom from failure much more than from success. We often discover what will do, by finding out what will not do; and probably he who never made a mistake never made a discovery.
motivation.author: Samuel Smiles

motivation.quote: Why worry about things you can’t control when you can keep yourself busy controlling the things that depend on you?
motivation.author: Unknown

motivation.quote: To be beautiful means to be yourself. You don’t need to be accepted by others. You need to accept yourself.
motivation.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

motivation.quote: Very few people really see things unless theyve had someone in early life who made them look at things. And name them too. But the looking is primary, the focus.
motivation.author: Denise Levertov

motivation.quote: If you want to study yourself — look into the hearts of other people. If you want to study other people — look into your own heart.
motivation.author: Friedrich von Schiller

motivation.quote: If your heart acquires strength, you will be able to remove blemishes from others without thinking evil of them.
motivation.author: Mohandas  Gandhi

motivation.quote: There is nothing more dreadful than the habit of doubt. Doubt separates people. It is a poison that disintegrates friendships and breaks up pleasant relations. It is a thorn that irritates and hurts; it is a sword that kill.
motivation.author: Buddha

motivation.quote: Deeds of kindness are equal in weight to all the commandments.
motivation.author: Talmud

motivation.quote: Life is like the dice that, falling, still show a different face. So life, though it remains the same, is always presenting different aspects.
motivation.author: Alexis

motivation.quote: Creativity requires the courage to let go of certainties.
motivation.author: Erich Fromm

motivation.quote: He who does not trust enough, Will not be trusted.
motivation.author: Lao Tzu

motivation.quote: Be Content with what you have; rejoice in the way things are. When you realize there is nothing lacking, the whole world belongs to you.
motivation.author: Lao Tzu

motivation.quote: There is only one success — to be able to spend your life in your own way.
motivation.author: Christopher Morley

motivation.quote: You may be deceived if you trust too much, but you will live in torment unless you trust enough.
motivation.author: Frank Crane

motivation.quote: Never tell me the sky’s the limit when there are footprints on the moon.
motivation.author: Unknown

motivation.quote: Look with favour upon a bold beginning.
motivation.author: Virgil

motivation.quote: I would rather be attacked than unnoticed. For the worst thing you can do to an author is to be silent as to his works. An assault upon a town is a bad thing; but starving it is still worse.
motivation.author: Samuel Johnson

motivation.quote: The dogmas of the quiet past are inadequate to the stormy present. The occasion is piled high with difficulty, and we must rise with the occasion. As our case is new, so we must think anew and act anew.
motivation.author: Abraham Lincoln

motivation.quote: There is as much greatness of mind in acknowledging a good turn, as in doing it.
motivation.author: Seneca

motivation.quote: It is better to conquer yourself than to win a thousand battles. Then the victory is yours. It cannot be taken from you, not by angels or by demons, heaven or hell.
motivation.author: Buddha

motivation.quote: To will is to select a goal, determine a course of action that will bring one to that goal, and then hold to that action till the goal is reached. The key is action.
motivation.author: Michael Hanson

motivation.quote: As far as your self-control goes, as far goes your freedom.
motivation.author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

motivation.quote: When one has the feeling of dislike for evil, when one feels tranquil, one finds pleasure in listening to good teachings; when one has these feelings and appreciates them, one is free of fear.
motivation.author: Buddha

motivation.quote: The aim of life is self-development. To realize ones nature perfectly — that is what each of us is here for.
motivation.author: Oscar Wilde

motivation.quote: What you are is what you have been. What you’ll be is what you do now.
motivation.author: Buddha

motivation.quote: People are not lazy. They simply have impotent goals — that is, goals that do not inspire them.
motivation.author: Tony Robbins

motivation.quote: Excellence can be obtained if you care more than others think is wise, risk more than others think is safe, dream more than others think is practical, expect more than others think is possible.
motivation.author: Unknown

motivation.quote: The greatest education in the world is watching the masters at work.
motivation.author: Michael Jackson

motivation.quote: When you get into a tight place and everything goes against you, till it seems as though you could not hang on a minute longer, never give up then, for that is justthe place and time that the tide will turn.
motivation.author: Harriet Stowe

motivation.quote: You have power over your mind — not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
motivation.author: Marcus Aurelius

motivation.quote: Courage is not about taking risks unknowingly but putting your own being in front of challenges that others may not be able to.
motivation.author: Byron Pulsifer

motivation.quote: In archery we have something like the way of the superior man. When the archer misses the center of the target, he turns round and seeks for the cause of his failure in himself.
motivation.author: Confucius

motivation.quote: Our achievements of today are but the sum total of our thoughts of yesterday. You are today where the thoughts of yesterday have brought you and you will be tomorrow where the thoughts of today take you.
motivation.author: Blaise Pascal

motivation.quote: Things should be made as simple as possible, but not any simpler.
motivation.author: Albert Einstein

motivation.quote: Each player must accept the cards life deals him or her: but once they are in hand, he or she alone must decide how to play the cards in order to win the game.
motivation.author: Voltaire

motivation.quote: The man who is aware of himself is henceforward independent; and he is never bored, and life is only too short, and he is steeped through and through with a profound yet temperate happiness.
motivation.author: Virginia Woolf

motivation.quote: A time splashed with interest, wounded with tragedy, crevassed with joy — that’s the time that seems long in the memory. And this is right when you think about it. Eventlessness has no posts to drape duration on.
motivation.author: John Steinbeck

motivation.quote: Treat a man as he is, he will remain so. Treat a man the way he can be and ought to be, and he will become as he can be and should be.
motivation.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

motivation.quote: To the timid and hesitating everything is impossible because it seems so.
motivation.author: Walter Scott

motivation.quote: We have a hunger of the mind which asks for knowledge of all around us, and the more we gain, the more is our desire; the more we see, the more we are capable of seeing.
motivation.author: Maria Mitchell

motivation.quote: How far you go in life depends on you being tender with the young, compassionate with the aged, sympathetic with the striving and tolerant of the weak and the strong. Because someday in life you will have been all of these.
motivation.author: George Washington Carver

motivation.quote: Kings and cabbages go back to compost, but good deeds stay green forever.
motivation.author: Rick de Marinis

motivation.quote: Your task is not to seek love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it.
motivation.author: Rumi

motivation.quote: Many people have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness. It is not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.
motivation.author: Helen Keller

motivation.quote: Watch your thoughts, they become your words Watch your words, they become your actions Watch your actions, they become your habits Watch your habits, they become your character Watch your character, it becomes your destiny.
motivation.author: Unknown

motivation.quote: Love the moment. Flowers grow out of dark moments. Therefore, each moment is vital. It affects the whole. Life is a succession of such moments and to live each, is to succeed.
motivation.author: Corita Kent

motivation.quote: The past is malleable and flexible, changing as our recollection interprets and re-explains what has happened.
motivation.author: Peter Berger

motivation.quote: Face what you think you believe and you will be surprised.
motivation.author: William White

motivation.quote: If you look over your left shoulder and it is saying to go this and your other shoulder is telling you to go the other way. Then just follow your heart and you will be OK.
motivation.author: Unknown

motivation.quote: To love someone deeply gives you strength. Being loved by someone deeply gives you courage.
motivation.author: Lao Tzu

motivation.quote: Do not give your attention to what others do or fail to do; give it to what you do or fail to do.
motivation.author: Dhammapada

motivation.quote: The life I touch for good or ill will touch another life, and that in turn another, until who knows where the trembling stops or in what far place my touch will be felt.
motivation.author: Frederick Buechner

motivation.quote: I recommend you to take care of the minutes: for hours will take care of themselves.
motivation.author: Chesterfield

motivation.quote: The hardest thing in the world is to simplify your life. It’s so easy to make it complex.
motivation.author: Unknown

motivation.quote: Dream barriers look very high until someone climbs them. They are not barriers any more.
motivation.author: Lasse Viren

motivation.quote: Consult your friend on all things, especially on those which respect yourself. His counsel may then be useful where your own self-love might impair your judgement.
motivation.author: Seneca

motivation.quote: Try to do unto others as you would have them do to you, and do not be discouraged if they fail sometimes. It is much better that they should fail than you should.
motivation.author: Charles Dickens

motivation.quote: We've got to have a dream if we are going to make a dream come true.
motivation.author: Walt Disney

motivation.quote: Love life and life will love you back. Love people and they will love you back.
motivation.author: Arthur Rubinstein

motivation.quote: Thought is the sculptor who can create the person you want to be.
motivation.author: Henry Thoreau

motivation.quote: You can fool some of the people all of the time, and all of the people some of the time, but you can not fool all of the people all of the time.
motivation.author: Abraham Lincoln

motivation.quote: If you worry about what might be, and wonder what might have been, you will ignore what is.
motivation.author: Unknown

motivation.quote: If you will practice being fictional for a while, you will understand that fictional characters are sometimes more real than people with bodies and heartbeats.
motivation.author: Richard Bach

motivation.quote: Heaven, in the production of things, is sure to be bountiful to them, according to their qualities. Hence the tree that is flourishing, it nourishes, while that which is ready to fall, it overthrows.
motivation.author: Confucius
Alan Kay
motivation.quote: Don't worry about what anybody else is going to do. The best way to predict the future is to invent it.

motivation.author: Donald Knuth
motivation.quote: Premature optimization is the root of all evil (or at least most of it) in programming.

motivation.author: Edsger Dijkstra, CACM, 15:10
motivation.quote: Lisp has jokingly been called "the most intelligent way to misuse a computer". I think that description is a great compliment because it transmits the full flavor of liberation: it has assisted a number of our most gifted fellow humans in thinking previously impossible thoughts.

motivation.author: Jeff "hemos" Bates, Director, OSDN; Co-evolver, Slashdot
motivation.quote: What Paul does, and does very well, is to take ideas and concepts that are beautiful in the abstract, and brings them down to a real world level. That's a rare talent to find in writing these days.

motivation.author: Yukihiro "Matz" Matsumoto, creator of Ruby
motivation.quote: Since programmers create programs out of nothing, imagination is our only limitation. Thus, in the world of programming, the hero is the one who has great vision. Paul Graham is one of our contemporary heroes. He has the ability to embrace the vision, and to express it plainly. His works are my favorites, especially the ones describing language design. He explains secrets of programming, languages, and human nature that can only be learned from the hacker experience. This book shows you his great vision, and tells you the truth about the nature of hacking.

motivation.author: Modern zen Poem
motivation.quote: To follow the path: look to the master, follow the master, walk with the master, see through the master, become the master.

motivation.author: Eric S. Raymond, How to become a hacker
motivation.quote: No problem should ever have to be solved twice.

motivation.author: Eric S. Raymond, How to become a hacker
motivation.quote: Attitude is no substitute for competence.

motivation.author: Juan Meng, Reviewing "The future of ideas" by Lawrence Lessig
motivation.quote: It is said that the real winner is the one who lives in today but able to see tomorrow.

motivation.author: Alan J. Perlis (Epigrams in programming)
motivation.quote: Fools ignore complexity. Pragmatists suffer it. Some can avoid it. Geniuses remove it.

motivation.author: Alan J. Perlis (Epigrams in programming)
motivation.quote: A year spent in artificial intelligence is enough to make one believe in God.

motivation.author: Alan J. Perlis (Epigrams in programmi ng)
motivation.quote: Dealing with failure is easy: Work hard to improve. Success is also easy to handle: You've solved the wrong problem. Work hard to improve.

motivation.author: Alan J. Perlis (Epigrams in programming)
motivation.quote: Within a computer natural language is unnatural.

motivation.author: Alan J. Perlis (Epigrams in programming)
motivation.quote: You think you know when you learn, are more sure when you can write, even more when you can teach, but certain when you can program.

motivation.author: Alan J. Perlis (Epigrams in programming)
motivation.quote: Adapting old programs to fit new machines usually means adapting new machines to behave like old ones.

motivation.author: Alexander Pope
motivation.quote: A little learning is a dangerous thing.

motivation.author: Eric Raymond
motivation.quote: Computer science education cannot make anybody an expert programmer any more than studying brushes and pigment can make somebody an expert painter.

motivation.author: Frederick P. Brooks, No Sliver Bullet.
motivation.quote: Einstein argued that there must be simplified explanations of nature, because God is not capricious or arbitrary.

motivation.author: Roger Schank, Engines for Education
motivation.quote: Students should be evaluated on how well they can achieve the goals they strived to achieve within a realistic context. Students need to learn to do things, not know things.

motivation.author: Roger Schank, Engines for Education
motivation.quote: We remember what we learn when we care about performing better and when we believe that what we have been asked to do is representative of reality.

motivation.author: Roger Schank, Engines for Education
motivation.quote: There really is no learning without doing.

motivation.author: Roger Schank, Engines for Education
motivation.quote: We really have to get over the idea that some stuff is just worth knowing even if you never do anything with it. Human memories happily erase stuff that has no purpose, so why try to fill up children's heads with such stuff.

motivation.author: E. W. Dijkstra, The humble programmer
motivation.quote: The only problems we can really solve in a satisfactory manner are those that finally admit a nicely factored solution.

motivation.author: E. W. Dijkstra, The humble programmer
motivation.quote: The best way to learn to live with our limitations is to know them.

motivation.author: E. W. Dijkstra, The humble programmer
motivation.quote: This challenge, viz. the confrontation with the programming task, is so unique that this novel experience can teach us a lot about ourselves. It should deepen our understanding of the processes of design and creation, it should give us better control over the task of organizing our thoughts. If it did not do so, to my taste we should no deserve the computer at all!  It has allready taught us a few lessons, and the one I have chosen to stress in this talk is the following. We shall do a much better programming job, provided that we approach the task with a full appreciation of its tremenduous difficulty, provided that we stick to modest and elegant programming languages, provided that we respect the intrinsec limitations of the human mind and approach the task as Very Humble Programmers.

motivation.author: Hermann Weyl, The Mathematical Way of Thinking
motivation.quote: We now come to the decisive step of mathematical abstraction: we forget about what the symbols stand for. ...[The mathematician] need not be idle; there are many operations which he may carry out with these symbols, without ever having to look at the things they stand for.

motivation.author: Eric Lippert.
motivation.quote: An expert is, according to my working definition "someone who doesn't need to look up answers to easy questions".

motivation.author: Alan J. Perlis
motivation.quote: The programmer must seek both perfection of part and adequacy of collection.

motivation.author: Alan J. Perlis
motivation.quote: Thus, programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.

motivation.author: Alan J. Perlis
motivation.quote: We control complexity by building abstractions that hide details when appropriate. We control complexity by establishing conventional interfaces that enable us to construct systems by combining standard, well-understood pieces in a ``mix and match'' way. We control complexity by establishing new languages for describing a design, each of which emphasizes particular aspects of the design and deemphasizes others.

motivation.author: John Locke, An Essay Concerning Human Understanding (1690)
motivation.quote: The acts of the mind, wherein it exerts its power over simple ideas, are chiefly these three: 1. Combining several simple ideas into one compound one, and thus all complex ideas are made. 2. The second is bringing two ideas, whether simple or complex, together, and setting them by one another so as to take a view of them at once, without uniting them into one, by which it gets all its ideas of relations. 3. The third is separating them from all other ideas that accompany them in their real existence: this is called abstraction, and thus all its general ideas are made.

motivation.author: Alan J. Perlis
motivation.quote: Lisp programmers know the value of everything but the cost of nothing.

motivation.author: SICP
motivation.quote: An interpreter raises the machine to the level of the user program; a compiler lowers the user program to the level of the machine language.

motivation.author: WestHost weekly newsletter 14 Feb 2003
motivation.quote: The great dividing line between success and failure can be expressed in five words: "I did not have time.".

motivation.author: Napoleon Bonaparte (allegedly)
motivation.quote: When your enemy is making a very serious mistake, don't be impolite and disturb him.

motivation.author: Hugh Kingsmill
motivation.quote: A charlatan makes obscure what is clear; a thinker makes clear what is obscure.

motivation.author: C. A. R. Hoare
motivation.quote: There are two ways of constructing a software design; one way is to make it so simple that there are obviously no deficiencies, and the other way is to make it so complicated that there are no obvious deficiencies. The first method is far more difficult.

motivation.author: Joel Spolsky
motivation.quote: And if you go too far up, abstraction-wise, you run out of oxygen. Sometimes smart thinkers just don't know when to stop, and they create these absurd, all-encompassing, high-level pictures of the universe that are all good and fine, but don't actually mean anything at all.

motivation.author: Larry Wall (Programming Perl)
motivation.quote: The three chief virtues of a programmer are: Laziness, Impatience and Hubris.

motivation.author: Joel Spolsky (The Law of Leaky Abstractions)
motivation.quote: All non-trivial abstractions, to some degree, are leaky.

motivation.author: Guido van Rossum
motivation.quote: XML wasn't designed to be edited by humans on a regular basis.

motivation.author: Keith Devens
motivation.quote: Premature abstraction is an equally grevious sin as premature optimization.

motivation.author: Bjarne Stroustrup
motivation.quote: You can have premature generalization as well as premature optimization.

motivation.author: Matthew 5:45
motivation.quote: He causes his sun to rise on the evil and the good, and sends rain on the righteous and the unrighteous.

motivation.author: Alan Perlis
motivation.quote: A language that doesn't affect the way you think about programming, is not worth knowing.

motivation.author: unknown
motivation.quote: Everybody makes their own fun. If you don't make it yourself, it ain't fun; it's entertainment.

motivation.author: Edsger Dijkstra
motivation.quote: If we wish to count lines of code, we should not regard them as *lines produced* but as *lines spent*.

motivation.author: Steven Den Beste
motivation.quote: Sometimes a man with too broad a perspective reveals himself as having no real perspective at all. A man who tries too hard to see every side may be a man who is trying to avoid choosing any side. A man who tries too hard to seek a deeper truth may be trying to hide from the truth he already knows.  That is not a sign of intellectual sophistication and "great thinking". It is a demonstration of moral degeneracy and cowardice.

motivation.author: William Strunk, Jr. (The Elements of Style)
motivation.quote: Omit needless words.

motivation.author: Brave New World (paraphrased)
motivation.quote: Philosophy: the finding of bad reasons for what one believes by instinct.

motivation.author: C.S. Lewis
motivation.quote: Of all tyrannies a tyranny sincerely exercised for the good of its victims may be the most oppressive. It may be better to live under robber barons than under omnipotent moral busybodies, The robber baron's cruelty may sometimes sleep, his cupidity may at some point be satiated; but those who torment us for own good will torment us without end, for they do so with the approval of their own conscience.

motivation.author: Catwoman (The Batman TV Series, episode 83)
motivation.quote: Fools! Don't they know that tears are a woman's most effective weapon.

motivation.author:
some chick in Alien vs. Predator, when asked why she
always carries a gun
motivation.quote: It's like a condom; I'd rather have it and not need it than need it and not have it.

motivation.author: Scott McKay
motivation.quote: C++ is history repeated as tragedy. Java is history repeated as farce.

motivation.author: unknown
motivation.quote: Simplicity takes effort. Genius, even.

motivation.author: unknown
motivation.quote: Show, don't tell.

motivation.author: David (Psalm 56:4)
motivation.quote: In God I trust; I will not be afraid. What can mortal man do to me.

motivation.author: Jamie Zawinski
motivation.quote: Linux is only free if your time has no value.

motivation.author: wordpress.org
motivation.quote: Code is poetry.

motivation.author: Rush (Freewill)
motivation.quote: If you choose not to decide, you still have made a choice.

motivation.author: Alfred North Whitehead (Introduction to Mathematics)
motivation.quote: Civilization advances by extending the number of important operations which we can perform without thinking about them.

motivation.author: Brad Bird, writer and director, The Incredibles
motivation.quote: The reason to do animation is caricature. Good caricature picks out the essense of the statement and removes everything else. It's not simply about reproducing reality; It's about bumping it up.

motivation.author: Ronald Reagan
motivation.quote: Mistakes were made.

motivation.author: "Hoots"
motivation.quote: I would rather be an optimist and be wrong than a pessimist who proves to be right. The former sometimes wins, but never the latter.

motivation.author: Pontius Pilate
motivation.quote: What is truth.

motivation.author: Ferris Bueller
motivation.quote: Life moves pretty fast. If you don't stop and look around once in a while, you could miss it.

motivation.author: Eric S. Raymond
motivation.quote: Lisp is worth learning for the profound enlightenment experience you will have when you finally get it; that experience will make you a better programmer for the rest of your days, even if you never actually use Lisp itself a lot.

motivation.author: Philip Greenspun (Greenspun's Tenth Rule)
motivation.quote: Any sufficiently complicated C or Fortran program contains an ad hoc, informally specified, bug-ridden, slow implementation of half of Common Lisp.

motivation.author: Paul Graham
motivation.quote: I was talking recently to a friend who teaches at MIT. His field is hot now and every year he is inundated by applications from would-be graduate students. "A lot of them seem smart," he said. "What I can't tell is whether they have any kind of taste.".

motivation.author: Donald Campbell
motivation.quote: The direct pursuit of happiness is a recipe for an unhappy life.

motivation.author: Randy S. Nelson (dean of Pixar University)
motivation.quote: It's no trick for talented people to be interesting, but it's a gift to be interested. We want an organization filled with interested people.

motivation.author: Randy S. Nelson (dean of Pixar University)
motivation.quote: Why teach drawing to accountants? Because drawing class doesn't just teach people to draw. It teaches them to be more observant. There's no company on earth that wouldn't benefit from having people become more observant.

motivation.author: Butler Lampson
motivation.quote: All problems in computer science can be solved by another level of indirection.

motivation.author: Antoine de St Exupery
motivation.quote: A designer knows he has arrived at perfection not when there is no longuer anything to add, but when there is no longuer anything to take away.

motivation.author: Hara Estroff Marano
motivation.quote: There are many ways to avoid success in life, but the most sure-fire just might be procrastination.

motivation.author: [fact]
motivation.quote: PI seconds is a nanocentury.

motivation.author: [fact]
motivation.quote: A non negative binary integer value x is a power of 2 iff (x & (x-1)) is 0 using 2's complement arithmetic.

motivation.author: [A comment on a blog]
motivation.quote: While I 've always appreciated beautiful code, I share Jonathan 's concern about studying it too much. I think studying beauty in music and painting has led us to modern classical music and painting that the majority of us just don 't get. Beauty can be seen when it emerges, but isn 't something to strive for in isolation of a larger context. In the software world, the larger context would be the utility of the software to the end user.

motivation.author: unknown
motivation.quote: Dont give users the opportunity to lock themselves.

motivation.author: unknown
motivation.quote: Any fool can make the simple complex, only a smart person can make the complex simple.

motivation.author: Paul Graham.
motivation.quote: To do something well you have to love it. So to the extent you can preserve hacking as something you love, you're likely to do it well. Try to keep the sense of wonder you had about programming at age 14. If you're worried that your current job is rotting your brain, it probably is.

motivation.author: [Ideas for flamewars]
motivation.quote: - If you give him a penny for his thoughts, you'd get change. - Not the sharpest knife in the drawer. - A prime candidate for natural deselection.

motivation.author: Paul Graham
motivation.quote: What I didn't understand was that the value of some new acquisition wasn't the difference between its retail price and what I paid for it. It was the value I derived from it. Stuff is an extremely illiquid asset. Unless you have some plan for selling that valuable thing you got so cheaply, what difference does it make what it's "worth?" The only way you're ever going to extract any value from it is to use it. And if you don't have any immediate use for it, you probably never will.

motivation.author: unknown
motivation.quote: Only bad designers blame their failings on the users.

motivation.author: unknown
motivation.quote: Humans aren't rational. They rationalize. And I don't just mean "some of them" or "other people". I'm talking about everyone. We have a "logic engine" in our brains, but for the most part, it's not the one in the driver's seat.

motivation.author: The culture code.
motivation.quote: What do Americans look for in a car? I've heard many answers when I've asked this question. The answers include excellent safety ratings, great gas mileage, handling, and cornering ability, among others. I don't believe any of these. That's because the first principle of the Culture Code is that the only effective way to understand what people truly mean is to ignore what they say. This is not to suggest that people intentionally lie or misrepresent themselves. What it means is that, when asked direct questions about their interests and preferences, people tend to give answers they believe the questioner wants to hear. Again, this is not because they intend to mislead. It is because people respond to these questions with their cortexes, the parts of their brains that control intelligence rather than emotion or instinct. They ponder a question, they process a question, and when they deliver an answer, it is the product of deliberation. They believe they are telling the truth. A lie detector would confirm this. In most cases, however, they aren't saying what they mean.

motivation.author: unknown
motivation.quote: When all you have is a hammer, everything looks like a nail.

motivation.author: http://www.catonmat.net
motivation.quote: Good coders code, great reuse.

motivation.author: Tim Harford
motivation.quote: The lesson of the story might appear to be that self-interested and ambitious people in power are often the cause of wastefulness in developing countries. But self-interested and ambitious people are in positions of power, great and small, all over the world. In many places, they are restrained by the law, the press, and democratic opposition. Cameroon's tragedy is that there is nothing to hold self-interest in check.

motivation.author: http://secretsofstudying.com/
motivation.quote: To solve your problems you must learn new skills, adapt new thought patterns, and become a different person than you were before that problem.  God has crafted you for success. In the middle of every adversity lie your best opportunities. Discover it, build upon it and move forward in your journey to live an extraordinary life.  You owe it to yourself to live a great life. Don 't let negative thoughts pull you down. Be grateful and open to learn and grow.

motivation.author: unknown
motivation.quote: If there is a will, there is a way.

motivation.author: [Fixing architecture flaws in Rails' ORM]
motivation.quote: Having large case statements in an object-oriented language is a sure sign your design is flawed.

motivation.author: Sincerity Theory
motivation.quote: Being a programmer is the same way. The only way to be a good programmer is to write code. When you realize you haven't been writing much code lately, and it seems like all you do is brag about code you wrote in the past, and people start looking at you funny while you're shooting your mouth off, realize it's because they know. They might not even know they know, but they know. So, yes, doing what you love brings success, and by all means, throw yourself a nice big party, buy yourself a nice car, soak up the adulation of an adoring crowd. Then shut the fuck up and get back to work.

motivation.author: The bipolar lisp programmer
motivation.quote: Another feature about this guy is his low threshold of boredom. He'll pick up on a task and work frantically at it, accomplishing wonders in a short time and then get bored and drop it before its properly finished. He'll do nothing but strum his guitar and lie around in bed for several days after.  Thats also part of the pattern too; periods of frenetic activity followed by periods of melancholia, withdrawal and inactivity. This is a bipolar personality.

motivation.author: David Heinemeier Hansson (Ruby On Rails' creator)
motivation.quote: My dream is that people adopt it on its own merits. We're not trying to bend Ruby on Rails to fit the enterprise, we're encouraging enterprises to bend to Ruby on Rails. Come if you like it, stay away if you don't. We're not going head over heels to accommodate the enterprise or to lure them away from Java. That's how you end up with Java, if you start bending to special interest groups.

motivation.author: William S. Annis
motivation.quote: New eyes have X-ray vision.  [someone that hasn't written it is more likely to spot the bug. "someone" can be you after a break.

motivation.author: Mark Chu-Carroll
motivation.quote: So - what are the most important problems in software engineering? I 'd answer "dealing with complexity".

motivation.author: Paul Graham (a talk at Y Combinator, for startup creators).
motivation.quote: So the mere constraint of staying in regular contact with us will push you to make things happen, because otherwise you'll be embarrassed to tell us that you haven't done anything new since the last time we talked.

motivation.author: Andreas Zwinkau
motivation.quote: The choice of the university is mostly important for the piece of paper you get at the end. The education you get depends on you.

motivation.author: Alexandru Vancea
motivation.quote: Remember that you are humans in the first place and only after that programmers.

motivation.author: SlideTrombone (comment on "Programming can ruin your life")
motivation.quote: Humans differ from animals to the degree that they are not merely an end result of their conditioning, but are able to reflect on their experiences and strategies, and apply insight to make changes in the way they live to modify the outcome.

motivation.author: Isaac (blog comment)
motivation.quote: As builders and creators finding the perfect solution should not be our main goal. We should find the perfect problem.

motivation.author: Super-sizing YouTube with Python. Just like carpentry, measure twice cut once.
motivation.quote: Mike Solomon

motivation.author: Douglas Crockford (Author of JSON and JsLint)
motivation.quote: The good thing about reinventing the wheel is that you get a round one.

motivation.author: Corneluis (comment on 'Are you going to change the world? (Really?)')
motivation.quote: I feel it is everybodies obligation to reach for the best in themselves and use that for the interest of mankind.

motivation.author: Bruce Wilder (blog post comment)
motivation.quote: Abstraction is a form of data compression: absolutely necessary, because human short-term memory is so small, but the critically important aspect of abstraction is the algorithm that gets you from the name back to the "uncompressed" details.

motivation.author: Paul Graham, The other road ahead.
motivation.quote: Have you ever noticed that when you sit down to write something, half the ideas that end up in it are ones you thought of while writing it? The same thing happens with software. Working to implement one idea gives you more ideas.

motivation.author: SICP, What is meant by data?
motivation.quote: In general, we can think of data as defined by some collection of selectors and constructors, together with specified conditions that these procedures must fulfill in order to be a valid representation.

motivation.author: Steve Yegge.
motivation.quote: Resume writing is just like dating, or applying for a bank loan, in that nobody wants you if you're desperate.

motivation.author: Joesgoals.com
motivation.quote: Mastering isn 't a survival instinct; it 's an urge to excel. Mastering is one of the experiences that delineates us from animals. It is striving to be more tomorrow than we are today; to perfectly pitch the ball over home plate; to craft the perfect sentence in an article; to open the oven and feel the warm, richly-scented cloud telling you dinner is going to be absolutely extraordinary. We humans crave perfection, to be masters of our domain, to distinguish ourselves by sheer skill and prowess.

motivation.author: Joesgoals.com
motivation.quote: It(mastering) 's knowing what you are doing.

motivation.author: Stevey, Refactoring Trilogy, Part 1.
motivation.quote: Well then. How could you possibly live without automated refactoring tools? How else could you coordinate the caterpillar-like motions of all Java 's identical tiny legs, its thousands of similar parts? I 'll tell you how: Ruby is a butterfly.

motivation.author: Marc (http://kickin-the-darkness.blogspot.com/)
motivation.quote: You will never become a Great Programmer until you acknowledge that you will always be a Terrible Programmer. You will remain a Great Programmer for only as long as you acknowledge that you are still a Terrible Programmer.

motivation.author: Bruce Lee
motivation.quote: If I tell you I'm good, you would probably think I'm boasting. If I tell you I'm no good, you know I'm lying.

motivation.author: VladimirSlepnev
motivation.quote: Let me try to get this straight: Lisp is a language for describing algorithms. This was JohnMcCarthy's original purpose, anyway: to build something more convenient than a Turing machine. Lisp is not about file, socket or GUI programming - Lisp is about expressive power. (For example, you can design multiple object systems for Lisp, in Lisp. Or implement the now-fashionable AOP. Or do arbitrary transformations on parsed source code.) If you don't value expressive power, Lisp ain't for you. I, personally, would prefer Lisp to not become mainstream: this would necessarily involve a dumbing down.

motivation.author: David Gorman (ImThere.com)
motivation.quote: If something isn 't working, you need to look back and figure out what got you excited in the first place.

motivation.author: Marc Andreessen (http://blog.pmarca.com/)
motivation.quote: Pay attention to opportunity cost at all times. Doing one thing means not doing other things. This is a form of risk that is very easy to ignore, to your detriment.

motivation.author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb, "The Black Swan".
motivation.quote: Seize any opportunity, or anything that looks like opportunity. They are rare, much rarer than you think...

motivation.author: Dan Nugent
motivation.quote: I think that a lot of programmers are ignoring an important point when people talk about reducing code repetition on large projects. Part of the idea is that large projects are intrinsically *wrong*. That you should be looking at making a number of smaller projects that are composable, even if you never end up reusing one of those smaller projects elsewhere.

motivation.author: Jared Diamond
motivation.quote: We tend to seek easy, single-factor explanations of success. For most important things, though, success actually requires avoiding many separate causes of failure.

motivation.author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe (1749-1832)
motivation.quote: Things which matter most must never be at the mercy of things which matter least.

motivation.author: Paul Graham, on the Lightweight Languages mailing list.
motivation.quote: I think the root of your mistake is saying that macros don't scale to larger groups. The real truth is that macros don't scale to stupider groups.

motivation.author: Paul Graham and Norbert Weiner, respectively
motivation.quote: Argue with idiots, and you become an idiot. If you compete with slaves you become a slave.

motivation.author: Chris Crawford
motivation.quote: Always dive down into a problem and get your hands on the deepest issue behind the problem. All other considerations are to dismissed as "engineering details"; they can be sorted out after the basic problem has been solved.

motivation.author: Alan Perlis
motivation.quote: Don't have good ideas if you aren't willing to be responsible for them.

motivation.author: Edsger Dijkstra
motivation.quote: It is impossible to sharpen a pencil with a blunt axe. It is equally vain to try to do it with ten blunt axes instead.

motivation.author: Edsger Dijkstra
motivation.quote: If we wish to count lines of code, we should not regard them as lines produced but as lines spent.

motivation.author: Rear Admiral Grace Hopper
motivation.quote: The most damaging phrase in the language is, It's always been done that way.

motivation.author: Reginald Braithwaite
motivation.quote: Getting back to failing early, I've learned it's important to completely fail. Get fired. Shoot the project, then burn its corpse. Melt the CVS repository and microwave the backup CDs. When things go wrong, I've often tried to play the hero from start to finish. Guess what? Some projects are doomed no matter what. Some need skills I don't possess. And some need a fresh face.

motivation.author: DJ MacLean
motivation.quote: The only thing a man should ever be 100% convinced of is his own ignorance.

motivation.author: Bob Sutton
motivation.quote: The best people and organizations have the attitude of wisdom: The courage to act on what they know right now and the humility to change course when they find better evidence. The quest for management magic and breakthrough ideas is overrated; being a master of the obvious is underrated. Jim Maloney is right: Work is an overrated activit.

motivation.author: Albert Einstein
motivation.quote: In theory, there 's no difference between theory and practice. But in practice, there is.

motivation.author: Erik Naggum
motivation.quote: Act from reason, and failure makes you rethink and study harder. Act from faith, and failure makes you blame someone and push harder.

motivation.author: Max Levchin, PayPal founder, Talk at StartupSchool2007
motivation.quote: Measure everything you can about the product, and you'll start seeing patterns.

motivation.author: Hadi Partovi & Ali Partovi (iLike.com), Talk at StartupSchool2007
motivation.quote: Quality of the people is better than the quality of the business idea. Crappy people can screw up the best idea in the world.

motivation.author: Mark Ward
motivation.quote: The only constant in the world of hi-tech is change.

motivation.author: http://www.cpax.org.uk/prg/
motivation.quote: Write it properly first. It's easier to make a correct program fast, than to make a fast program correct.

motivation.author: BetterExplained.com
motivation.quote: You can 't get to version 500 if you don 't start with a version 1.

motivation.author: BetterExplained.com
motivation.quote: The wonderful and frustrating thing about understanding yourself is that nobody can do it for you.

motivation.author: Sherlock Holmes
motivation.quote: When you have eliminated the impossible, whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth.

motivation.author: George Miller
motivation.quote: In order to understand what another person is saying, you must assume that it is true and try to find out what it could be true of.

motivation.author: Lao­Tzu
motivation.quote: A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.

motivation.author: Ben Hoyts (micropledge)
motivation.quote: C 's great for what it 's great for.

motivation.author: Paolo Bonzini
motivation.quote: There is one meaning [for static in C]: a global variable that is invisible outside the current scope, be it a function or a file.

motivation.author: LeCamarade (freeshells.ch)
motivation.quote: Processors don't get better so that they can have more free time. Processors get better so _you_ can have more free time.

motivation.author: Bjarne Stroustrap
motivation.quote: Understanding why C++ is the way it is helps a programmer use it well. A deep understanding of a tool is essential for an expert craftsman.

motivation.author: Alberti
motivation.quote: No art, however minor, demands less than total dedication if you want to excel in it.

motivation.author: engtech (internetducttape.com)
motivation.quote: The minute you put the blame on someone else you 've switch things from being a problem you can control to a problem outside of your control.

motivation.author: OO Sucks (bluetail.com)
motivation.quote: State is the root of all evil. In particular functions with side effects should be avoided.

motivation.author: WikiHow
motivation.quote: It is better to be quiet and thought a fool than to open your mouth and remove all doubt.

motivation.author: ASPN : Python Cookbook : Explicit Tail Call
motivation.quote: A tail call allows a function to return the result of another function without leaving an entry on the stack. Tail recursion is a specific case of tail calling.

motivation.author: Dr. Koichi Kawana
motivation.quote: Simplicity means the achievement of maximum effect with minimum means.

motivation.author: Ridderstrale & Nordstorm, Funky Business
motivation.quote: Normality is the route to nowhere.

motivation.author: Steve Jobs
motivation.quote: The problem is that Microsoft just has no taste. And I don't mean that in a small way, I mean that in a big way.

motivation.author: Steve Jobs, to John Sculley (former Pepsi executive)
motivation.quote: Do you want to sell sugared water all your life or do you want to change the world.

motivation.author: Lawrence Lessig, Free Culture.
motivation.quote: 1 - Creativity and innovation always build on the past. 2 - The past always tries to control the creativity that builds on it. 3 - Free societies enable the future by limiting the past. 4 - Ours is less and less a free society.

motivation.author: H. Hardy, A mathematician's apology.
motivation.quote: Good work is no done by ‘humble ' men.

motivation.author: Dennis (blog comment)
motivation.quote: Simplicity and pragmatism beat complexity and theory any day.

motivation.author: G. H. Hardy
motivation.quote: The proof is by reductio ad absurdum, and reductio ad absurdum, which Euclid loved so much, is one of a mathematician 's finest weapons. It is a far finer gambit than any chess gambit: a chess player may offer the sacrifice of a pawn or even a piece, but a mathematician offers the game.

motivation.author: Joss Whedon
motivation.quote: Remember, always be yourself ... unless you suck.

motivation.author: Chuck Norris(?)
motivation.quote: All great things require great dedication.

motivation.author: Crayz (Commentor on blog.raganwald.com)
motivation.quote: I'm always happy to trade performance for readability as long as the former isn't already scarce.

motivation.author: Reginald Braithwait
motivation.quote: You have to write for your audience. I would never write (1..5).map &'*2' in Java when I could write ListFactoryFactory.getListFactoryFromResource( new ResourceName('com.javax.magnitudes.integers'). setLowerBound(1).setUpperBound(5).setStep(1).applyFunctor( new Functor () { public void eval (x) { return x * 2; } })) I'm simplifying, of course, I've left out the security and logging wrappers.

motivation.author: Benjamin Franklin
motivation.quote: The definition of insanity is doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.

motivation.author: Mahatma Gandhi
motivation.quote: A no uttered from the deepest conviction is better than a yes merely uttered to please or what is worse, to avoid trouble.

motivation.author: E. W. Dijkstra
motivation.quote: I think it is wise, and only honest, to warn you that my goal is immodest. It is not my purpose to "transfer knowledge" to you that, subsequently, you can forget again. My purpose is no less than to effectuate in each of you a noticeable, irreversable change. I want you to gain, for the rest of your lives, the insight that beautiful proofs are not "found" by trial anf error but are the result of a consciously applied design discipline. I want you to raise your quality standards. I mean, if 10 years from now, when you are doing something quick and dirty, you suddenly visualize that I am looking over your shoulders and say to yourself "Dijkstra would not have liked this", well, that would be enough immortality for me.

motivation.author: Richard P. Gabriel & Ron Goldman, Mob Software: The Erotic Life of Code
motivation.quote: The general principle for complexity design is this: Think locally, act locally.

motivation.author: Some guy who isn't famous
motivation.quote: Programming is the art of figuring out what you want so precisely that even a machine can do it.

motivation.author: E. W. Dijkstra, On the nature of computing science.
motivation.quote: Hence my urgent advice to all of you to reject the morals of the bestseller society and to find, to start with, your reward in your own fun. This is quite feasible, for the challenge of simplification is so fascinating that, if we do our job properly, we shall have the greatest fun in the world.

motivation.author: Eric KEDJI
motivation.quote: Remember: you are alone. Every time you can get help from someone, it is an opportunity: you should eagerly size it. But then, promptly return to normal mode: you are alone and you must be prepared to solve every problem yourself.

motivation.author: smoothspan.com
motivation.quote: Making All Software Into Tools Reduces Risk.

motivation.author: Matz, LL2
motivation.quote: Some may say Ruby is a bad rip-off of Lisp or Smalltalk, and I admit that. But it is nicer to ordinary people.

motivation.author: Steve Yegge, Tour de Babel.
motivation.quote: C and Lisp stand at opposite ends of the spectrum; they're each great at what the other one sucks at.

motivation.author: unknown
motivation.quote: Two people should stay together if together they are better people than they would be individually.

motivation.author: Unknown (quoted in `Robust Systems', Gerald Jay Suseman)
motivation.quote: To the optimist, the glass is half full. To the pessimist, the glass is half empty. To the engineer, the glass is twice as big as it needs to be.

motivation.author: Earl of Chesterfield
motivation.quote: Whatever is worth doing at all, is worth doing well.

motivation.author: M.A. Jackson
motivation.quote: Rules of Optimization: Rule 1: Don 't do it. Rule 2 (for experts only): Don 't do it yet.

motivation.author: W.A. Wulf
motivation.quote: More computing sins are committed in the name of efficiency (without necessarily achieving it) than for any other single reason - including blind stupidity.

motivation.author: Donald Knuth
motivation.quote: We should forget about small efficiencies, say about 97% of the time: premature optimization is the root of all evil.

motivation.author: Voltaire
motivation.quote: The best is the enemy of the good.

motivation.author: Ralph Nader
motivation.quote: The job of a leader today is not to create followers. It 's to create more leaders.

motivation.author: The little book of leadership
motivation.quote: The president was visiting NASA headquarters and stopped to talk to a man who was holding a mop. "And what do you do?" he asked. The man, a janitor, replied, "I 'm helping to put a man on the moon, sir."

motivation.author: Phil Dourado
motivation.quote: Only make new mistakes.

motivation.author: Richard Feynman
motivation.quote: You can recognize truth by its beauty and simplicity. When you get it right, it is obvious that it is right.

motivation.author: William Shakespeare, "Henry VI"
motivation.quote: Talkers are no good doers.

motivation.author: Eric Hamilton
motivation.quote: Photography is painting with light.

motivation.author: Pablo Picasso
motivation.quote: Good artists copy. Great artists steal.

motivation.author: Niklaus Wirth
motivation.quote: A guideline in the process of stepwise refinement should be the principle to decompose decisions as much as possible, to untangle aspects which are only seemingly interdependent, and to defer those decisions which concern details of representation as long as possible.

motivation.author: William Strunk, Jr. (The Elements of Style)
motivation.quote: Vigorous writing is concise. A sentence should contain no unnecessary words, a paragraph no unnecessary sentences, for the same reason that a drawing should have no unnecessary lines and a machine no unnecessary parts. This requires not that the writer make all sentences short or avoid all detail and treat subjects only in outline, but that every word tell.

motivation.author: Steve Yegge.
motivation.quote: The problem is that small examples fail to convince, and large examples are too big to follow.

motivation.author: Aristotle.
motivation.quote: We are the sum of our behaviours; excellence therefore is not an act but a habit.

motivation.author: Edsger Dijkstra
motivation.quote: The purpose of abstraction is not to be vague, but to create a new semantic level in which one can be absolutely precise.

motivation.author: Seneca
motivation.quote: Every man prefers belief to the exercise of judgment.

motivation.author: Nathan Weizenbaum
motivation.quote: It 's hard to grasp abstractions if you don 't understand what they 're abstracting away from.

motivation.author: Paul Graham
motivation.quote: That is one of the most distinctive differences between school and the real world: there is no reward for putting in a good effort. In fact, the whole concept of a "good effort" is a fake idea adults invented to encourage kids. It is not found in nature.

motivation.author: Thomas Jefferson
motivation.quote: I find that the harder I work, the more luck I seem to have.

motivation.author: George Burns
motivation.quote: Don't stay in bed, unless you can make money in bed.

motivation.author: Mario Andretti
motivation.quote: If everything seems under control, you're not going fast enough.

motivation.author: Brian Kernigan
motivation.quote: Controlling complexity is the essence of computer programming.

motivation.author: Grady Booch
motivation.quote: The function of good software is to make the complex appear to be simple.

motivation.author: Rich Cook
motivation.quote: Programmers are in a race with the Universe to create bigger and better idiot-proof programs, while the Universe is trying to create bigger and better idiots.  So far the Universe is winning.

motivation.author: Peter Seebach
motivation.quote: A hacker on a roll may be able to produce–in a period of a few months–something that a small development group (say, 7-8 people) would have a hard time getting together over a year.  IBM used to report that certain programmers might be as much as 100 times as productive as other workers, or more.

motivation.author: Randall E. Stross
motivation.quote: The best programmers are not marginally better than merely good ones. They are an order-of-magnitude better, measured by whatever standard: conceptual creativity, speed, ingenuity of design, or problem-solving ability.

motivation.author: Bill Gates
motivation.quote: A great lathe operator commands several times the wage of an average lathe operator, but a great writer of software code is worth 10,000 times the price of an average software writer.

motivation.author: Bill Gates
motivation.quote: Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.

motivation.author: George Carrette
motivation.quote: First learn computer science and all the theory.  Next develop a programming style.  Then forget all that and just hack.

motivation.author: L. Peter Deutsch
motivation.quote: To iterate is human, to recurse divine.

motivation.author: Anonymous
motivation.quote: The best thing about a boolean is even if you are wrong, you are only off by a bit.

motivation.author: Stan Kelly-Bootle
motivation.quote: Should array indices start at 0 or 1?  My compromise of 0.5 was rejected without, I thought, proper consideration.

motivation.author: E.W. Dijkstra
motivation.quote: The use of COBOL cripples the mind; its teaching should therefore be regarded as a criminal offense.

motivation.author: E. W. Dijkstra
motivation.quote: It is practically impossible to teach good programming style to students that have had prior exposure to BASIC.  As potential programmers, they are mentally mutilated beyond hope of regeneration.

motivation.author: Robert Firth
motivation.quote: One of the main causes of the fall of the Roman Empire was that–lacking zero–they had no way to indicate successful termination of their C programs.

motivation.author: Alanna
motivation.quote: Saying that Java is nice because it works on all OSes is like saying that anal sex is nice because it works on all genders.

motivation.author: Robert Sewell
motivation.quote: If Java had true garbage collection, most programs would delete themselves upon execution.

motivation.author: Linus Torvalds
motivation.quote: Software is like sex: It 's better when it 's free.

motivation.author: Eagleson 's Law
motivation.quote: Any code of your own that you haven 't looked at for six or more months might as well have been written by someone else.

motivation.author: Francis Glassborow
motivation.quote: Good programmers use their brains, but good guidelines save us having to think out every case.

motivation.author: Bill Clinton
motivation.quote: Considering the current sad state of our computer programs, software development is clearly still a black art, and cannot yet be called an engineering discipline.

motivation.author: Edsger W. Dijkstra
motivation.quote: If debugging is the process of removing bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.

motivation.author: Charles H. Duell, Commissioner, U.S. Office of Patents, 1899
motivation.quote: Everything that can be invented has been invented.

motivation.author: Thomas J. Watson, Chairman of the Board, IBM, circa 1948
motivation.quote: I think there 's a world market for about 5 computers.

motivation.author: John Von Neumann, circa 1949
motivation.quote: It would appear that we have reached the limits of what it is possible to achieve with computer technology, although one should be careful with such statements, as they tend to sound pretty silly in 5 years.

motivation.author:
Engineer at the Advanced Computing Systems Division of IBM,
commenting on the microchip, 1968
motivation.quote: But what is it good for.

motivation.author: Ken Olson, President, Digital Equipment Corporation, 1977
motivation.quote: There is no reason for any individual to have a computer in his home.

motivation.author: Bill Gates, 1981
motivation.quote: 640K ought to be enough for anybody.

motivation.author: Microsoft, on the development of Windows NT, 1992
motivation.quote: Windows NT addresses 2 Gigabytes of RAM, which is more than any application will ever need.

motivation.author: Andy Pierson
motivation.quote: We will never become a truly paper-less society until the Palm Pilot folks come out with WipeMe 1.0.

motivation.author: Frank Lloyd Wright
motivation.quote: If it keeps up, man will atrophy all his limbs but the push-button finger.

motivation.author: arcus, #scheme on Freenode

motivation.author: Jeffrey Mark Siskind
motivation.quote: Its a shame that the students of our generation grew up with windows and mice because that tainted our mindset not to think in terms of powerful tools. Some of us are just so tainted that we will never recover.

motivation.author: John Foderaro
motivation.quote: Lisp is a programmable programming language.

motivation.author: Lament
motivation.quote: I guess, when you're drunk, every woman looks beautiful and every language looks (like) a Lisp.

motivation.author: Pablo Picasso
motivation.quote: You must always work not just within but below your means. If you can handle three elements, handle only two. If you can handle ten, then handle five. In that way the ones you do handle, you handle with more ease, more mastery and you create a feeling of strength in reserve.

motivation.author: Gary Kildall (inventor of CP/M, one of the first OS for the micro).
motivation.quote: When you 've got the code all ripped apart, it 's like a car that 's all disassembled. You 've got all the parts tying all over your garage and you have to replace the broken part or the car will never run. It 's not fun until the code gets back to the baseline again.

motivation.author: Gary Kildall (inventor of CP/M, one of the first OS for the micro).
motivation.quote: Well, if you talk about programming to a group of programmers who use the same language, they can become almost evangelistic about the language. They form a tight-knit community, hold to certain beliefs, and follow certain rules in their programming. It 's like a church with a programming language for a Bible.

motivation.author: Gary Kildall (inventor of CP/M, one of the first OS for the micro).
motivation.quote: It 's a problem if the design doesn 't let you add features at a later date. If you have to redo a program, the hours you spend can cause you to lose your competitive edge. A flexible program demonstrates the difference between a good designer and someone who is just getting a piece of code out.

motivation.author: Gary Kildall (inventor of CP/M, one of the first OS for the micro).
motivation.quote: [How friendly will this machine be?] Well, I don 't think it 's a matter of friendliness, because ultimately if the program is going to accomplish anything of value, it will probably be relatively complex.

motivation.author: Gary Kildall (inventor of CP/M, one of the first OS for the micro).
motivation.quote: Some people suggest that machines would be friendlier if input could be in a natural language. But natural language is probably the worst kind of input because it can be quite ambiguous. The process of retrieving information from the computer would be so time-consuming that you would be better off spending that time getting the information directly from an expert.

motivation.author: Arthur C. Clarke
motivation.quote: The only way of discovering the limits of the possible is to venture a little way past them into the impossible.

motivation.author: Arthur C. Clarke
motivation.quote: Any sufficiently advanced technology is undistinguishable from magic.

motivation.author: Malcolm Gladwell, Who says big ideas are rare?
motivation.quote: That is the inevitable human response. We 're reluctant to believe that great discoveries are in the air. We want to believe that great discoveries are in our heads—and to each party in the multiple the presence of the other party is invariably cause for suspicion.

motivation.author: Malcolm Gladwell, Who says big ideas are rare?
motivation.quote: Good ideas are out there for anyone with the wit and the will to find them.

motivation.author: Philip Greenspun
motivation.quote: A person won't become proficient at something until he or she has done it many times. In other words., if you want someone to be really good at building a software system, he or she will have to have built 10 or more systems of that type.

motivation.author: Philip Greenspun
motivation.quote: A person won't retain proficiency at a task unless he or she has at one time learned to perform that task very rapidly. Learning research demonstrates that the skills of people who become accurate but not fast deteriorate much sooner than the skills of people who become both accurate and fast.

motivation.author: Philip Greenspun
motivation.quote: Training research shows that if you get speed now you can get quality later. But if you don't get speed you will never get quality in the long run.

motivation.author: Donald Knuth
motivation.quote: Beware of bugs in the above code; I have only proved it correct, not tried it.

motivation.author: Nassim Taleb
motivation.quote: Wear your best for your execution and stand dignified. Your last recourse against randomness is how you act — if you can 't control outcomes, you can control the elegance of your behaviour. You will always have the last word.

motivation.author: Anonymous
motivation.quote: The human brain starts working the moment you are born and never stops until you stand up to speak in public.

motivation.author: Bertrand Russell
motivation.quote: The trouble with the world is that the stupid are always cocksure and the intelligent are always filled with doubt.

motivation.author: Dee Hock, Birth of the Chaordic Age

motivation.author: Mark Tarver (of "The bipolar Lisp programmer" fame)

motivation.author: Alan Kay

motivation.author: Alan Kay
motivation.quote: Simple things should be simple. Complex things should be possible.

motivation.author: Alan Kay
motivation.quote: I invented the term Object-Oriented, and I can tell you I did not have C++ in mind.

motivation.author: Alan Kay
motivation.quote: All creativity is an extended form of a joke.

motivation.author: Alan Kay
motivation.quote: If you don't fail at least 90 percent of the time, you're not aiming high enough.

motivation.author: Alan Kay

Official definition of "duck typing" - if it looks like a duck, walks like a duck, and quacks like a duck, it's a duck.
motivation.author: Unknown
almkgor, on reddit
motivation.quote: In OO, it's the data that is the "important" thing: you define the class which contains member data, and only incidentally contains code for manipulating the object. In FP, it's the code that's important: you define a function which contains code for working with the data, and only incidentally define what the data is.

motivation.author: Linux Torvalds
motivation.quote: It was Edison who said ‘1% inspiration, 99% perspiration '. That may have been true a hundred years ago. These days it's ‘0.01% inspiration, 99.99% perspiration ', and the inspiration is the easy part.

motivation.author: Bertrand Russell
motivation.quote: The greatest challenge to any thinker is stating the problem in a way that will allow a solution.

motivation.author: Steve Jobs
motivation.quote: [Innovation] comes from saying no to 1,000 things to make sure we don 't get on the wrong track or try to do too much. We 're always thinking about new markets we could enter, but it 's only by saying no that you can concentrate on the things that are really important.

motivation.author: Thomas Edison
motivation.quote: Genius is 1% inspiration and 99% perspiration.

motivation.author: Richard Sites

motivation.author: Vim user manual

motivation.author: Tim Gallwey, The inner game of work
motivation.quote: I had to learn how to teach less, so that more could be learned.

motivation.author: Tim Gallwey, The inner game of work
motivation.quote: Workers of the world, the chains that bind you are not held in place by a ruling class, a "superior" race, by society, the state, or a leader. They are held in place by none other than yourself. Those who seek to exploit are not themselves free, for they place no value in freedom. Who is it that really employs you and commands you to pick up your daily load? And who is it that you allow to pass judgment on the adequacy of your toil? Who have you empowered to dangle the carrot before you and threaten with disapproval? Who, when you wake each morning, sends you off to what you call your work? Is there an "I want to" behind all your "I have to," or have you been so long forgotten to yourself that "I want" exists only as an idea in your head? If you have disconnected from your soul's desire and are drowning in an ocean of "have to," then rise up and overthrow your master. Begin the journey toward emancipation.  Work only in such a way that you are truly self-employed.

motivation.author: Ted Kennedy
motivation.quote: The Work Begins Anew, The Hope Rises Again, And The Dream Lives On.

motivation.author: Donald Norman
motivation.quote: The hardest part of design ... is keeping features out.

motivation.author: Elie Wiesel
motivation.quote: The opposite of love is not hate, it is indifference.

motivation.author: How to fail: 25 secrets learned through failure

motivation.author: Albert Einstein

The thing that keeps you going and keeps you creative is never to loose your imagination. Always dream of things that are better, and think about ways to reach them

motivation.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
motivation.quote: If you want to build a ship, don't drum up people to collect wood and don't assign them tasks and work, but rather teach them to long for the endless immensity of the sea.

motivation.quote: It isn't the mountains ahead to climb that wear you out; it's the pebble in your shoe.

motivation.author: John Dewey

No matter how abominable your condition may be, try not to blame anything or anybody: history, the state, superiors, race, parents, the phase of the moon, childhood, toilet training, etc. The moment that you place blame somewhere, you undermine your resolve to change anything.

motivation.quote: Nothing comes to a sleeper but a dream.

motivation.author: Steve Jobs

motivation.quote: One must learn by doing the thing; for though you think you know it, you have no certainty until you try.
